  by (simp add: ext)

lemma deriv_deriv_exp [simp]: "deriv (deriv exp) x = exp x"
  by simp

lemma twice_field_differentiable_at_exp [simp, intro]:
  "exp twice_field_differentiable_at x"
proof -
  have "âxâUNIV. exp field_differentiable at x"
   and "deriv exp field_differentiable at x"
    by (simp_all add: field_differentiable_within_exp)
  then show ?thesis
    unfolding twice_field_differentiable_at_def field_differentiable_on_def
    by auto
qed

lemma twice_field_differentiable_at_exp_fun [simp, intro]:
  assumes "f twice_field_differentiable_at x"
  shows "(Î»x. exp (f x)) twice_field_differentiable_at x"
  by (simp add: assms twice_field_differentiable_at_compose)

subsubsectionâ¹Square Rootâº

lemma deriv_real_sqrt [simp]: "x > 0 â¹ deriv sqrt x = inverse (sqrt x) / 2"
  using DERIV_imp_deriv DERIV_real_sqrt by blast

lemma has_real_derivative_inverse_sqrt:
  assumes "x > 0"
  shows "((Î»x. inverse (sqrt x) / 2) has_real_derivative - (inverse (sqrt x ^ 3) / 4)) (at x)"
proof -
  have inv_sqrt_mult: "(inverse (sqrt x)/2) * (sqrt x * 2) = 1"
    using assms by simp
  have inv_sqrt_mult2: "(- inverse ((sqrt x)^3)/2)* x * (sqrt x * 2) = -1"
    using assms by (simp add: field_simps power3_eq_cube)
  then show ?thesis
    using assms by (safe intro!: DERIV_imp_deriv derivative_eq_intros)
        (auto intro: derivative_eq_intros inv_sqrt_mult [THEN ssubst] inv_sqrt_mult2 [THEN ssubst]
              simp add: divide_simps power3_eq_cube)
qed

lemma deriv_deriv_real_sqrt':
  assumes "x > 0"
  shows "deriv (Î»x. inverse (sqrt x) / 2) x = - inverse ((sqrt x)^3)/4"
  by (simp add: DERIV_imp_deriv assms has_real_derivative_inverse_sqrt)

lemma has_real_derivative_deriv_sqrt:
  assumes "x > 0"
  shows "(deriv sqrt has_real_derivative - inverse (sqrt x ^ 3) / 4) (at x)"
proof -
  have "((Î»x. inverse (sqrt x) / 2) has_real_derivative - inverse (sqrt x ^ 3) / 4) (at x)"
    using assms has_real_derivative_inverse_sqrt by auto
  moreover
  {fix xa :: real
   assume "xa â {0<..}"
   then have "inverse (sqrt xa) / 2 = deriv sqrt xa"
     by simp
  }
  ultimately show ?thesis
    using has_field_derivative_transform_within_open [where S="{0 <..}" and f="(Î»x. inverse (sqrt x) / 2)"]
    by (meson assms greaterThan_iff open_greaterThan)
qed

lemma deriv_deriv_real_sqrt [simp]:
  assumes "x > 0"
  shows "deriv(deriv sqrt) x = - inverse ((sqrt x)^3)/4"
  using DERIV_imp_deriv assms has_real_derivative_deriv_sqrt by blast

lemma twice_field_differentiable_at_sqrt [simp, intro]:
  assumes "x > 0"
    shows "sqrt twice_field_differentiable_at x"
proof -
  have "sqrt field_differentiable_on {0<..}"
    by (metis DERIV_real_sqrt at_within_open field_differentiable_def field_differentiable_on_def
        greaterThan_iff open_greaterThan)
  moreover have "x â interior {0<..}"
    by (metis assms greaterThan_iff interior_interior interior_real_atLeast)
  moreover have "deriv sqrt field_differentiable at x"
    using assms field_differentiable_def has_real_derivative_deriv_sqrt by blast
  ultimately show ?thesis
    using twice_field_differentiable_at_def by blast
qed

lemma twice_field_differentiable_at_sqrt_fun [intro]:
  assumes "f twice_field_differentiable_at x"
    and "f x > 0"
  shows "(Î»x. sqrt (f x)) twice_field_differentiable_at x"
  by (simp add: assms(1) assms(2) twice_field_differentiable_at_compose)

subsubsectionâ¹Natural Powerâº

lemma field_differentiable_power [simp]:
  "(Î»x. x ^ n) field_differentiable at x"
  using DERIV_power DERIV_ident field_differentiable_def
  by blast

lemma deriv_power_fun [simp]:
  assumes "f field_differentiable at x"
    shows "deriv (Î»x. f x ^ n) x = of_nat n * deriv f x * f x ^ (n - 1)"
  using DERIV_power[of f "deriv f x"]
  by (simp add:  DERIV_imp_deriv assms field_differentiable_derivI mult.assoc [symmetric])

lemma deriv_power [simp]:
  "deriv (Î»x. x ^ n) x = of_nat n * x ^ (n - 1)"
  using DERIV_power[of "Î»x. x" 1] DERIV_imp_deriv by force

lemma deriv_deriv_power [simp]:
  "deriv (deriv (Î»x. x ^ n)) x = of_nat n * of_nat (n - Suc 0) * x ^ (n - 2)"
proof -
  have "(Î»x. x ^ (n - 1)) field_differentiable at x"
    by simp
  then have "deriv (Î»x. of_nat n * x ^ (n - 1)) x = of_nat n * of_nat (n - Suc 0) * x ^ (n - 2)"
    by (simp add: diff_diff_add mult.assoc numeral_2_eq_2)
  then show ?thesis
    by (simp add: ext[OF deriv_power])
qed

lemma twice_field_differentiable_at_power [simp, intro]:
  "(Î»x. x ^ n) twice_field_differentiable_at x"
proof -
  have "âxâUNIV. (Î»x. x ^ n) field_differentiable at x"
    by simp
  moreover have "deriv ((Î»x. x ^ n)) field_differentiable at x"
  proof -
    have "deriv ((Î»x. x ^ n)) = (Î»x. of_nat n * x ^ (n - 1))"
      by (simp add: ext)
    then show ?thesis
      using field_differentiable_mult[of "Î»x. of_nat n" x UNIV "Î»x. x ^ (n - 1)"]
      by (simp add: field_differentiable_caratheodory_at)
  qed
  ultimately show ?thesis
    unfolding twice_field_differentiable_at_def field_differentiable_on_def
    by force
qed

lemma twice_field_differentiable_at_power_fun [intro]:
  assumes "f twice_field_differentiable_at x"
    shows "(Î»x. f x ^ n) twice_field_differentiable_at x"
  by (blast intro: assms twice_field_differentiable_at_compose [OF _ twice_field_differentiable_at_power])

subsubsectionâ¹Inverseâº

lemma eventually_deriv_inverse:
  assumes "x â  0"
    shows "ââ©F x in nhds x. deriv inverse x = - 1 / (x ^ 2)"
proof -
  obtain T where open_T: "open T" and "âzâT. z â  0" and x_in_T: "x â T"
    using assms t1_space by blast

  then have "âx â T. deriv inverse x = - 1 / (x ^ 2)"
    by simp
  then show ?thesis
    using eventually_nhds open_T x_in_T by blast
qed

lemma deriv_deriv_inverse [simp]:
  assumes "x â  0"
  shows "deriv (deriv inverse) x = 2 * inverse (x ^ 3)"
proof -
  have "deriv (Î»x. inverse (x ^ 2)) x = - (of_nat 2 * x) / ((x ^ 2) ^ 2)"
    using assms by simp
  moreover have "(Î»x. inverse (x ^ 2)) field_differentiable at x"
    using assms by (simp add: field_differentiable_inverse)
  ultimately have "deriv (Î»x. - (inverse (x ^ 2))) x = of_nat 2 * x / (x ^ 4)"
    using deriv_chain[of "Î»x. inverse (x ^ 2)" x]
    by (simp add: comp_def field_differentiable_minus field_simps)
  then have "deriv (Î»x. - 1 / (x ^ 2)) x = 2 * inverse (x ^ 3)"
    by (simp add: power4_eq_xxxx power3_eq_cube field_simps)
  then show ?thesis
    using assms eventually_deriv_inverse deriv_cong_ev by fastforce
qed

lemma twice_field_differentiable_at_inverse [simp, intro]:
  assumes "x â  0"
  shows "inverse twice_field_differentiable_at x"
proof -
  obtain T where zero_T: "0 â T" and x_in_T: "x â T" and open_T: "open T"
    using assms t1_space by blast
  then have "T â {z. z â  0}"
    by blast
  then have "âxâT. inverse field_differentiable at x within T"
    using DERIV_inverse field_differentiable_def by blast
  moreover have "deriv inverse field_differentiable at x"
  proof -
    have "(Î»x. - inverse (x ^ 2)) field_differentiable at x"
      using assms by (simp add: field_differentiable_inverse field_differentiable_minus)
    then have "(Î»x. - 1 / (x ^ 2)) field_differentiable at x"
      by (simp add: inverse_eq_divide)
    then show ?thesis
      using eventually_deriv_inverse[OF assms]
      by (simp add: DERIV_cong_ev field_differentiable_def)
  qed
  moreover have "x â interior T"
    by (simp add: x_in_T open_T interior_open)
  ultimately show ?thesis
    unfolding twice_field_differentiable_at_def field_differentiable_on_def
    by blast
qed

lemma twice_field_differentiable_at_inverse_fun [simp, intro]:
  assumes "f twice_field_differentiable_at x"
          "f x â  0"
  shows "(Î»x. inverse (f x)) twice_field_differentiable_at x"
  by (simp add: assms twice_field_differentiable_at_compose)

lemma twice_field_differentiable_at_divide [intro]:
  assumes "f twice_field_differentiable_at x"
      and "g twice_field_differentiable_at x"
      and "g x â  0"
    shows "(Î»x. f x / g x) twice_field_differentiable_at x"
  by (simp add: assms divide_inverse twice_field_differentiable_at_mult)

subsubsectionâ¹Polynomialâº

lemma twice_field_differentiable_at_polyn [simp, intro]:
  fixes coef :: "nat â 'a :: {real_normed_field}"
    and n :: nat
  shows "(Î»x. âi<n. coef i * x ^ i) twice_field_differentiable_at x"
proof (induction n)
  case 0
  then show ?case
    by simp
next
  case hyp: (Suc n)
  show ?case
  proof (simp, rule twice_field_differentiable_at_add)
    show "(Î»x. âi<n. coef i * x ^ i) twice_field_differentiable_at x"
      by (rule hyp)
    show "(Î»x. coef n * x ^ n) twice_field_differentiable_at x"
      using twice_field_differentiable_at_compose[of "Î»x. x ^ n" x "(*) (coef n)"]
      by simp
  qed
qed

lemma twice_field_differentiable_at_polyn_fun [simp]:
  fixes coef :: "nat â 'a :: {real_normed_field}"
    and n :: nat
  assumes "f twice_field_differentiable_at x"
  shows "(Î»x. âi<n. coef i * f x ^ i) twice_field_differentiable_at x"
  by (blast intro: assms twice_field_differentiable_at_compose [OF _ twice_field_differentiable_at_polyn])

end

Theory HyperdualFunctionExtension

(*  Title:   HyperdualFunctionExtension.thy
    Authors: Jacques D. Fleuriot and Filip Smola, University of Edinburgh, 2021
*)

section â¹Hyperdual Extension of Functionsâº

theory HyperdualFunctionExtension
  imports Hyperdual TwiceFieldDifferentiable
begin

textâ¹The following is an important fact in the derivation of the hyperdual extension.âº
lemma
    fixes x :: "('a :: comm_ring_1) hyperdual" and n :: nat
  assumes "Base x = 0"
    shows "x ^ (n + 3) = 0"
proof (induct n)
  case 0
  then show ?case
    using assms hyperdual_power[of x 3] by simp
next
  case (Suc n)
  then show ?case
    using assms power_Suc[of x "n + 3"] mult_zero_right add_Suc by simp
qed

textâ¹We define the extension of a function to the hyperdual numbers.âº
primcorec hypext :: "(('a :: real_normed_field) â 'a) â 'a hyperdual â 'a hyperdual" (â¹*h* _âº [80] 80)
  where
    "Base ((*h* f) x) = f (Base x)"
  | "Eps1 ((*h* f) x) = Eps1 x * deriv f (Base x)"
  | "Eps2 ((*h* f) x) = Eps2 x * deriv f (Base x)"
  | "Eps12 ((*h* f) x) = Eps12 x * deriv f (Base x) + Eps1 x * Eps2 x * deriv (deriv f) (Base x)"

textâ¹This has the expected behaviour when expressed in terms of the units.âº
lemma hypext_Hyperdual_eq:
  "(*h* f) (Hyperdual a b c d) =
     Hyperdual (f a) (b * deriv f a) (c * deriv f a) (d * deriv f a + b * c * deriv (deriv f) a)"
  by (simp add: hypext.code)

lemma hypext_Hyperdual_eq_parts:
  "(*h* f) (Hyperdual a b c d) =
      f a *â©H ba + (b * deriv f a) *â©H e1 + (c * deriv f a) *â©H e2 +
         (d * deriv f a + b * c * deriv (deriv f) a) *â©H e12 "
  by (metis Hyperdual_eq hypext_Hyperdual_eq)

textâ¹
  The extension can be used to extract the function value, and first and second derivatives at x
  when applied to @{term "x *â©H re + e1 + e2 + 0 *â©H e12"}, which we denote by @{term "Î² x"}.
âº
definition hyperdualx :: "('a :: real_normed_field) â 'a hyperdual" ("Î²")
  where "Î² x = (Hyperdual x 1 1 0)"

lemma hyperdualx_sel [simp]:
  shows "Base (Î² x) = x"
    and "Eps1 (Î² x) = 1"
    and "Eps2 (Î² x) = 1"
    and "Eps12 (Î² x) = 0"
  by (simp_all add: hyperdualx_def)

lemma hypext_extract_eq:
  "(*h* f) (Î² x) = f x *â©H ba + deriv f x *â©H e1 + deriv f x *â©H e2 + deriv (deriv f) x *â©H e12"
  by (simp add: hypext_Hyperdual_eq_parts hyperdualx_def)

lemma Base_hypext:
  "Base ((*h* f) (Î² x)) = f x"
  by (simp add: hyperdualx_def)

lemma Eps1_hypext:
  "Eps1 ((*h* f) (Î² x)) = deriv f x"
  by (simp add: hyperdualx_def)

lemma Eps2_hypext:
  "Eps2 ((*h* f) (Î² x)) = deriv f x"
  by (simp add: hyperdualx_def)

lemma Eps12_hypext:
  "Eps12 ((*h* f) (Î² x)) = deriv (deriv f) x"
  by (simp add: hyperdualx_def)

subsubsectionâ¹Convenience Interfaceâº

textâ¹Define a datatype to hold the function value, and the first and second derivative values.âº
datatype ('a :: real_normed_field) derivs = Derivs (Value: 'a) (First: 'a) (Second: 'a)

textâ¹
  Then we convert a hyperdual number to derivative values by extracting the base component, one of
  the first-order components, and the second-order component.
âº
fun hyperdual_to_derivs :: "('a :: real_normed_field) hyperdual â 'a derivs"
  where "hyperdual_to_derivs x = Derivs (Base x) (Eps1 x) (Eps12 x)"

textâ¹
  Finally we define way of converting any compatible function into one that yields the value and the
  derivatives.
âº
fun autodiff :: "('a :: real_normed_field â 'a) â 'a â 'a derivs"
  where "autodiff f = (Î»x. hyperdual_to_derivs ((*h* f) (Î² x)))"

lemma autodiff_sel:
  "Value (autodiff f x) = Base ((*h* f) (Î² x))"
  "First (autodiff f x) = Eps1 ((*h* f) (Î² x))"
  "Second (autodiff f x) = Eps12 ((*h* f) (Î² x))"
  by simp_all

textâ¹The result contains the expected values.âº
lemma autodiff_extract_value:
  "Value (autodiff f x) = f x"
  by (simp del: hypext.simps add: Base_hypext)

lemma autodiff_extract_first:
  "First (autodiff f x) = deriv f x"
  by (simp del: hypext.simps add: Eps1_hypext)

lemma autodiff_extract_second:
  "Second (autodiff f x) = deriv (deriv f) x"
  by (simp del: hypext.simps add: Eps12_hypext)

textâ¹
  The derivative components of the result are actual derivatives if the function is sufficiently
  differentiable on that argument.
âº
lemma autodiff_first_derivative:
  assumes "f field_differentiable (at x)"
  shows "(f has_field_derivative First (autodiff f x)) (at x)"
  by (simp add: autodiff_extract_first DERIV_deriv_iff_field_differentiable assms)

lemma autodiff_second_derivative:
  assumes "f twice_field_differentiable_at x"
  shows "((deriv f) has_field_derivative Second (autodiff f x)) (at x)"
  by (simp add: autodiff_extract_second DERIV_deriv_iff_field_differentiable assms deriv_field_differentiable_at)

subsubsectionâ¹Compositionâº

textâ¹Composition of hyperdual extensions is the hyperdual extension of composition:âº
lemma hypext_compose:
  assumes "f twice_field_differentiable_at (Base x)"
      and "g twice_field_differentiable_at (f (Base x))"
    shows "(*h* (Î»x. g (f x))) x = (*h* g) ((*h* f) x)"
proof (simp add: hyperdual_eq_iff, intro conjI disjI2)
  show goal1: "deriv (Î»x. g (f x)) (Base x) = deriv f (Base x) * deriv g (f (Base x))"
  proof -
    have "deriv (Î»x. g (f x)) (Base x) = deriv (g â f) (Base x)"
      by (simp add: comp_def)
    also have "... = deriv g (f (Base x)) * deriv f (Base x)"
      using assms by (simp add: deriv_chain once_field_differentiable_at)
    finally show ?thesis
      by (simp add: mult.commute deriv_chain)
  qed
  then show "deriv (Î»x. g (f x)) (Base x) = deriv f (Base x) * deriv g (f (Base x))" .

  have first_diff: "(Î»x. deriv g (f x)) field_differentiable at (Base x)"
    by (metis DERIV_chain2 assms deriv_field_differentiable_at field_differentiable_def once_field_differentiable_at)

  have "deriv (deriv g â f) (Base x) = deriv (deriv g) (f (Base x)) * deriv f (Base x)"
    using deriv_chain assms once_field_differentiable_at deriv_field_differentiable_at
    by blast
  then have deriv_deriv_comp: "deriv (Î»x. deriv g (f x)) (Base x) = deriv (deriv g) (f (Base x)) * deriv f (Base x)"
    by (simp add: comp_def)

  have "deriv (deriv (Î»x. g (f x))) (Base x) = deriv ((Î»x. deriv f x * deriv g (f x))) (Base x)"
    using assms eventually_deriv_compose'[of f "Base x" g]
    by (simp add: mult.commute deriv_cong_ev)
  also have "... = deriv f (Base x) * deriv (Î»x. deriv g (f x)) (Base x) + deriv (deriv f) (Base x) * deriv g (f (Base x))"
    using assms(1) first_diff by (simp add: deriv_field_differentiable_at)
  also have "... = deriv f (Base x) * deriv (deriv g) (f (Base x)) * deriv f (Base x) + deriv (deriv f) (Base x) * deriv g (f (Base x))"
    using deriv_deriv_comp by simp
  finally show "Eps12 x * deriv (Î»x. g (f x)) (Base x) + Eps1 x * Eps2 x * deriv (deriv (Î»x. g (f x))) (Base x) =
    (Eps12 x * deriv f (Base x) + Eps1 x * Eps2 x * deriv (deriv f) (Base x)) * deriv g (f (Base x)) +
    Eps1 x * deriv f (Base x) * (Eps2 x * deriv f (Base x)) * deriv (deriv g) (f (Base x))"
    by (simp add: goal1 field_simps)
qed

subsectionâ¹Concrete Instancesâº

subsubsectionâ¹Constantâº

textâ¹Component embedding is an extension of the constant function.âº
lemma hypext_const [simp]:
  "(*h* (Î»x. a)) x = of_comp a"
  by (simp add: of_comp_def hyperdual_eq_iff)

lemma "autodiff (Î»x. a) = (Î»x. Derivs a 0 0)"
  by simp

subsubsectionâ¹Identityâº

textâ¹Identity is an extension of the component identity.âº
lemma hypext_ident:
  "(*h* (Î»x. x)) x = x"
  by (simp add: hyperdual_eq_iff)

subsubsectionâ¹Component Scalar Multiplicationâº

textâ¹Component scaling is an extension of component constant multiplication:âº
lemma hypext_scaleH:
  "(*h* (Î»x. k * x)) x = k *â©H x"
  by (simp add: hyperdual_eq_iff)

lemma hypext_fun_scaleH:
  assumes "f twice_field_differentiable_at (Base x)"
  shows "(*h* (Î»x. k * f x)) x = k *â©H (*h* f) x"
  using assms by (simp add: hypext_compose hypext_scaleH)

textâ¹Unary minus is just an instance of constant multiplication:âº
lemma hypext_uminus:
  "(*h* uminus) x = - x"
  using hypext_scaleH[of "-1" x] by simp

subsubsectionâ¹Real Scalar Multiplicationâº

textâ¹Real scaling is an extension of component real scaling:âº
lemma hypext_scaleR:
  "(*h* (Î»x. k *â©R x)) x = k *â©R x"
  by (auto simp add: hyperdual_eq_iff)

lemma hypext_fun_scaleR:
  assumes "f twice_field_differentiable_at (Base x)"
  shows "(*h* (Î»x. k *â©R f x)) x = k *â©R (*h* f) x"
  using assms by (simp add: hypext_compose hypext_scaleR)

subsubsectionâ¹Additionâº

textâ¹Addition of hyperdual extensions is a hyperdual extension of addition of functions.âº
lemma hypext_fun_add:
  assumes "f twice_field_differentiable_at (Base x)"
      and "g twice_field_differentiable_at (Base x)"
    shows "(*h* (Î»x. f x + g x)) x = (*h* f) x + (*h* g) x"
proof (simp add: hyperdual_eq_iff distrib_left[symmetric], intro conjI disjI2)
  show goal1: "deriv (Î»x. f x + g x) (Base x) = deriv f (Base x) + deriv g (Base x)"
    by (simp add: assms once_field_differentiable_at distrib_left)
  then show "deriv (Î»x. f x + g x) (Base x) = deriv f (Base x) + deriv g (Base x)" .

  have "deriv (deriv (Î»x. f x + g x)) (Base x) = deriv (Î»w. deriv f w + deriv g w) (Base x)"
    by (simp add: assms deriv_cong_ev eventually_deriv_add)
  moreover have "Eps12 x * deriv f (Base x) + Eps12 x * deriv g (Base x) = Eps12 x * deriv (Î»x. f x + g x) (Base x)"
    by (metis distrib_left goal1)
  ultimately show "Eps12 x * deriv (Î»x. f x + g x) (Base x) +
    Eps1 x * Eps2 x * deriv (deriv (Î»x. f x + g x)) (Base x) =
    Eps12 x * deriv f (Base x) + Eps1 x * Eps2 x * deriv (deriv f) (Base x) +
    (Eps12 x * deriv g (Base x) + Eps1 x * Eps2 x * deriv (deriv g) (Base x))"
    using deriv_add[OF deriv_field_differentiable_at deriv_field_differentiable_at, OF assms]
    by (simp add: distrib_left add.left_commute)
qed

lemma hypext_cadd [simp]:
  "(*h* (Î»x. x + a)) x = x + of_comp a"
  by (auto simp add: hyperdual_eq_iff of_comp_def)

lemma hypext_fun_cadd:
  assumes "f twice_field_differentiable_at (Base x)"
  shows "(*h* (Î»x. f x + a)) x = (*h* f) x + of_comp a"
  using assms hypext_compose[of f x "Î»x. x + a"] by simp

subsubsectionâ¹Component Linear Functionâº

textâ¹Hyperdual linear function is an extension of the component linear function:âº
lemma hypext_linear:
  "(*h* (Î»x. k * x + a)) x = k *â©H x + of_comp a"
  using hypext_fun_add[of "(*) k" x "Î»x. a"]
  by (simp add: hypext_scaleH)

lemma hypext_fun_linear:
  assumes "f twice_field_differentiable_at (Base x)"
    shows "(*h* (Î»x. k * f x + a)) x = k *â©H (*h* f) x + of_comp a"
  using assms hypext_compose[of f x "Î»x. k * x + a"] by (simp add: hypext_linear)

subsubsectionâ¹Real Linear Functionâº

textâ¹We have the same for real scaling instead of component multiplication:âº
lemma hypext_linearR:
  "(*h* (Î»x. k *â©R x + a)) x = k *â©R x + of_comp a"
  using hypext_fun_add[of "(*â©R) k" x "Î»x. a"]
  by (simp add: hypext_scaleR)

lemma hypext_fun_linearR:
  assumes "f twice_field_differentiable_at (Base x)"
    shows "(*h* (Î»x. k *â©R f x + a)) x = k *â©R (*h* f) x + of_comp a"
  using assms hypext_compose[of f x "Î»x. k *â©R x + a"] by (simp add: hypext_linearR)

subsubsectionâ¹Multiplicationâº

textâ¹Extension of multiplication is multiplication of the functions' extensions.âº
lemma hypext_fun_mult:
  assumes "f twice_field_differentiable_at (Base x)"
      and "g twice_field_differentiable_at (Base x)"
    shows "(*h* (Î»z. f z * g z)) x = (*h* f) x * (*h* g) x"
proof (simp add: hyperdual_eq_iff distrib_left[symmetric], intro conjI)
  show "Eps1 x * deriv (Î»z. f z * g z) (Base x) =
        f (Base x) * (Eps1 x * deriv g (Base x)) + Eps1 x * deriv f (Base x) * g (Base x)"
   and "Eps2 x * deriv (Î»z. f z * g z) (Base x) =
        f (Base x) * (Eps2 x * deriv g (Base x)) + Eps2 x * deriv f (Base x) * g (Base x)"
    using assms by (simp_all add: once_field_differentiable_at distrib_left)

  have
    "deriv (deriv (Î»z. f z * g z)) (Base x) =
     f (Base x) * deriv (deriv g) (Base x) + 2 * deriv f (Base x) * deriv g (Base x) + deriv (deriv f) (Base x) * g (Base x)"
  proof -
    have "deriv (deriv (Î»z. f z * g z)) (Base x) = deriv (Î»z. f z * deriv g z + deriv f z * g z) (Base x)"
      using assms by (simp add: eventually_deriv_mult deriv_cong_ev)
    also have "... = (Î»z. f z * deriv (deriv g) z + deriv f z * deriv g z + deriv f z * deriv g z + deriv (deriv f) z * g z) (Base x)"
      by (simp add: assms deriv_field_differentiable_at field_differentiable_mult once_field_differentiable_at)
    finally show ?thesis
      by simp
  qed
  then show
    "Eps12 x * deriv (Î»z. f z * g z) (Base x) + Eps1 x * Eps2 x * deriv (deriv (Î»z. f z * g z)) (Base x) =
     2 * (Eps1 x * (Eps2 x * (deriv f (Base x) * deriv g (Base x)))) +
     f (Base x) * (Eps12 x * deriv g (Base x) + Eps1 x * Eps2 x * deriv (deriv g) (Base x)) +
     (Eps12 x * deriv f (Base x) + Eps1 x * Eps2 x * deriv (deriv f) (Base x)) * g (Base x)"
     using assms by (simp add: once_field_differentiable_at field_simps)
qed

subsubsectionâ¹Sine and Cosineâº

textâ¹The extended sin and cos at an arbitrary hyperdual.âº

lemma hypext_sin_Hyperdual:
  "(*h* sin) (Hyperdual a b c d) = sin a *â©H ba + (b *cos a) *â©H e1 + (c * cos a) *â©H e2 + (d * cos a - b * c * sin a) *â©H e12 "
  by (simp add: hypext_Hyperdual_eq_parts)

lemma hypext_cos_Hyperdual:
  "(*h* cos) (Hyperdual a b c d) = cos a *â©H ba - (b * sin a) *â©H e1 - (c * sin a) *â©H e2 - (d * sin a + b * c * cos a) *â©H e12 "
proof -
  have "of_comp (- (d * sin a) - b * c * cos a) * e12 = - (of_comp (d * sin a + b * c * cos a) * e12)"
    by (metis add_uminus_conv_diff minus_add_distrib mult_minus_left of_comp_minus)
  then show ?thesis
    by (simp add: hypext_Hyperdual_eq_parts of_comp_minus scaleH_times)
qed

lemma Eps1_hypext_sin [simp]:
  "Eps1 ((*h* sin) x) = Eps1 x * cos (Base x)"
  by simp

lemma Eps2_hypext_sin [simp]:
  "Eps2 ((*h* sin) x) = Eps2 x * cos (Base x)"
  by simp

lemma Eps12_hypext_sin [simp]:
  "Eps12 ((*h* sin) x) = Eps12 x * cos (Base x) - Eps1 x * Eps2 x * sin (Base x)"
  by simp

lemma hypext_sin_e1 [simp]:
  "(*h* sin) (x * e1) = e1 * x"
  by (simp add: e1_def hyperdual_eq_iff one_hyperdual_def)

lemma hypext_sin_e2 [simp]:
  "(*h* sin) (x * e2) = e2 * x"
  by (simp add: e2_def hyperdual_eq_iff one_hyperdual_def)

lemma hypext_sin_e12 [simp]:
  "(*h* sin) (x * e12) = e12 * x"
  by (simp add: e12_def hyperdual_eq_iff one_hyperdual_def)

lemma hypext_cos_e1 [simp]:
  "(*h* cos) (x * e1) = 1"
  by (simp add: e1_def hyperdual_eq_iff one_hyperdual_def)

lemma hypext_cos_e2 [simp]:
  "(*h* cos) (x * e2) = 1"
  by (simp add: e2_def hyperdual_eq_iff one_hyperdual_def)

lemma hypext_cos_e12 [simp]:
  "(*h* cos) (x * e12) = 1"
  by (simp add: e12_def hyperdual_eq_iff one_hyperdual_def)

textâ¹The extended sin and cos at @{term "Î² x"}.âº

lemma hypext_sin_extract:
  "(*h* sin) (Î² x) = sin x *â©H ba + cos x *â©H e1 + cos x *â©H e2 - sin x *â©H e12"
  by (simp add: hypext_sin_Hyperdual of_comp_minus scaleH_times hyperdualx_def)

textâ¹We get one of the key trigonometric properties for the extensions of sin and cos.âº

lemma "((*h* sin) x)â§2 + ((*h* cos) x)â§2 = 1"
  by (simp add: hyperdual_eq_iff one_hyperdual_def power2_eq_square field_simps)

subsubsectionâ¹Square Rootâº
textâ¹Square root function extension.âº

lemma hypext_sqrt_Hyperdual_Hyperdual:
  assumes "a > 0"
  shows "(*h* sqrt) (Hyperdual a b c d) =
         Hyperdual (sqrt a) (b * inverse (sqrt a) / 2) (c * inverse (sqrt a) / 2)
           (d * inverse (sqrt a) / 2 - b * c * inverse (sqrt a ^ 3) / 4)"
  by (simp add: assms hypext_Hyperdual_eq)

lemma hypext_sqrt_Hyperdual:
      "a > 0 â¹ (*h* sqrt) (Hyperdual a b c d) =
       sqrt a *â©H ba + (b * inverse (sqrt a) / 2) *â©H e1 + (c * inverse (sqrt a) / 2) *â©H e2 +
       (d * inverse (sqrt a) / 2 - b * c * inverse (sqrt a ^ 3) / 4) *â©H e12"
  by (auto simp add: hypext_Hyperdual_eq_parts)

lemma hypext_sqrt_extract:
  "x > 0 â¹ (*h* sqrt) (Î² x) = sqrt x *â©H ba + (inverse (sqrt x) / 2) *â©H e1 +
        (inverse (sqrt x) / 2) *â©H e2 - (inverse (sqrt x ^ 3) / 4) *â©H e12"
  by (simp add: hypext_sqrt_Hyperdual hyperdualx_def of_comp_minus scaleH_times)

textâ¹Extracting the parts for the square root extension.âº

lemma Eps1_hypext_sqrt_extract [simp]:

  using Eps1_hypext[of sqrt] by simp

  "x > 0 â¹ Eps2 ((*h* sqrt) (Î² x)) = inverse (sqrt x) / 2"
  using Eps2_hypext[of sqrt] by simp

lemma Eps12_hypext_sqrt_extract [simp]:
  "x > 0 â¹ Eps12 ((*h* sqrt) (Î² x)) = - (inverse (sqrt x ^ 3) / 4)"
  using Eps12_hypext[of sqrt] by simp

(* example *)

  by (simp add: hypext_fun_add)

subsubsectionâ¹Natural Powerâº

lemma hypext_power:
  "(*h* (Î»x. x ^ n)) x = x ^ n"
  by (simp add: hyperdual_eq_iff hyperdual_power)

lemma hypext_fun_power:
  assumes "f twice_field_differentiable_at (Base x)"
    shows "(*h* (Î»x. (f x) ^ n)) x = ((*h* f) x) ^ n"
  using assms hypext_compose[of f x "Î»x. x ^ n"] by (simp add: hypext_power)

lemma hypext_power_Hyperdual:
  "(*h* (Î»x. x ^ n)) (Hyperdual a b c d) =
        a ^ n *â©H ba + (of_nat n * b * a ^ (n - 1)) *â©H e1 + (of_nat n * c * a ^ (n - 1)) *â©H e2 +
        (d * (of_nat n * a ^ (n - 1)) + b * c * (of_nat n * of_nat (n - 1) * a ^ (n - 2))) *â©H e12"
  by (simp add: hypext_Hyperdual_eq_parts algebra_simps)

lemma hypext_power_Hyperdual_parts:
  "(*h* (Î»x. x ^ n)) (a *â©H ba + b *â©H e1 + c *â©H e2 + d *â©H e12) =
        a ^ n *â©H ba + (of_nat n * b * a ^ (n - 1)) *â©H e1 + (of_nat n * c * a ^ (n - 1)) *â©H e2 +
        (d * (of_nat n * a ^ (n - 1)) + b * c * (of_nat n * of_nat (n - 1) * a ^ (n - 2))) *â©H e12"
  by (simp add: Hyperdual_eq [symmetric] hypext_power_Hyperdual)

lemma hypext_power_extract:
  "(*h* (Î»x. x ^ n)) (Î² x) =
      x ^ n *â©H ba + (of_nat n * x ^ (n - 1)) *â©H e1 + (of_nat n * x ^ (n - 1)) *â©H e2 +
      (of_nat n * of_nat (n - 1) * x ^ (n - 2)) *â©H e12"
  by (simp add: hypext_extract_eq)

lemma Eps1_hypext_power [simp]:
  "Eps1 ((*h* (Î»x. x ^ n)) x) = of_nat n * Eps1 x * (Base x) ^ (n - 1)"
  by simp

lemma Eps2_hypext_power [simp]:
  "Eps2 ((*h* (Î»x. x ^ n)) x) = of_nat n * Eps2 x * (Base x) ^ (n - 1)"
  by simp

lemma Eps12_hypext_power [simp]:
  "Eps12 ((*h* (Î»x. x ^ n)) x) =
   Eps12 x * (of_nat n * Base x ^ (n - 1)) + Eps1 x * Eps2 x * (of_nat n * of_nat (n - 1) * Base x ^ (n - 2))"
  by simp

subsubsectionâ¹Inverseâº

lemma hypext_inverse:
  assumes "Base x â  0"
  shows "(*h* inverse) x = inverse x"
  using assms by (simp add: hyperdual_eq_iff inverse_eq_divide)

lemma hypext_fun_inverse:
  assumes "f twice_field_differentiable_at (Base x)"
      and "f (Base x) â  0"
    shows "(*h* (Î»x. inverse (f x))) x = inverse ((*h* f) x)"
  using assms hypext_compose[of f x inverse] by (simp add: hypext_inverse)

lemma hypext_inverse_Hyperdual:
  "a â  0 â¹
    (*h* inverse) (Hyperdual a b c d) =
    Hyperdual (inverse a) (- (b / aâ§2)) (- (c / aâ§2)) (2 * b * c / (a ^ 3) - d / aâ§2)"
  by (simp add: hypext_Hyperdual_eq divide_inverse)

lemma hypext_inverse_Hyperdual_parts:
  "a â  0 â¹
    (*h* inverse) (a *â©H ba + b *â©H e1 + c *â©H e2 + d *â©H e12) =
    inverse a *â©H ba + - (b / aâ§2) *â©H e1 + - (c / aâ§2) *â©H e2 + (2 * b * c / a ^ 3 - d / aâ§2) *â©H e12"
  by (metis Hyperdual_eq hypext_inverse_Hyperdual)

lemma inverse_Hyperdual_parts:
  "(a::'a::real_normed_field) â  0 â¹
    inverse (a *â©H ba + b *â©H e1 + c *â©H e2 + d *â©H e12) =
    inverse a *â©H ba + - (b / aâ§2) *â©H e1 + - (c / aâ§2) *â©H e2 + (2 * b * c / a ^ 3 - d / aâ§2) *â©H e12"
  by (metis Hyperdual_eq hyperdual.sel(1) hypext_inverse hypext_inverse_Hyperdual_parts)

lemma hypext_inverse_extract:
  "x â  0 â¹ (*h* inverse) (Î² x) = inverse x *â©H ba - (1 / xâ§2) *â©H e1 - (1 / xâ§2) *â©H e2 + (2 / x ^ 3) *â©H e12"
  by (simp add: hypext_extract_eq divide_inverse of_comp_minus scaleH_times)

lemma inverse_extract:
  "x â  0 â¹ inverse (Î² x) = inverse x *â©H ba - (1 / xâ§2) *â©H e1 - (1 / xâ§2) *â©H e2 + (2 / x ^ 3) *â©H e12"
  by (metis hyperdual.sel(1) hyperdualx_def hypext_inverse hypext_inverse_extract)

lemma Eps1_hypext_inverse [simp]:
  "Base x â  0 â¹ Eps1 ((*h* inverse) x) = - Eps1 x * (1 / (Base x)â§2)"
  by simp
lemma Eps1_inverse [simp]:
  "Base (x::'a::real_normed_field hyperdual) â  0 â¹ Eps1 (inverse x) = - Eps1 x * (1 / (Base x)â§2)"
  by simp

lemma Eps2_hypext_inverse [simp]:
  "Base (x::'a::real_normed_field hyperdual) â  0 â¹ Eps2 (inverse x) = - Eps2 x * (1 / (Base x)â§2)"
  by simp

lemma Eps12_hypext_inverse [simp]:
  "Base  (x::'a::real_normed_field hyperdual) â  0
   â¹ Eps12 (inverse x) = Eps1 x * Eps2 x * (2/ (Base x ^ 3)) - Eps12 x / (Base x)â§2"
  by simp

subsubsectionâ¹Divisionâº

lemma hypext_fun_divide:
  assumes "f twice_field_differentiable_at (Base x)"
      and "g twice_field_differentiable_at (Base x)"
      and "g (Base x) â  0"
    shows "(*h* (Î»x. f x / g x)) x = (*h* f) x / (*h* g) x"
proof -
  have "(Î»x. inverse (g x)) twice_field_differentiable_at Base x"
    by (simp add: assms(2) assms(3) twice_field_differentiable_at_compose)
  moreover have "(*h* f) x * (*h* (Î»x. inverse (g x))) x = (*h* f) x * inverse ((*h* g) x)"
    by (simp add: assms(2) assms(3) hypext_fun_inverse)
  ultimately have "(*h* (Î»x. f x * inverse (g x))) x = (*h* f) x * inverse ((*h* g) x)"
    by (simp add: assms(1) hypext_fun_mult)
  then show ?thesis
    by (simp add: divide_inverse hyp_divide_inverse)
qed

subsubsectionâ¹Polynomialâº

lemma hypext_polyn:
  fixes coef :: "nat â 'a :: {real_normed_field}"
    and n :: nat
  shows "(*h* (Î»x. âi<n. coef i * x^i)) x = (âi<n. (coef i) *â©H (x^i))"
proof (induction n)
  case 0
  then show ?case
    by (simp add: zero_hyperdual_def)
next
  case hyp: (Suc n)

  have "(Î»x. âi<Suc n. coef i * x ^ i) = (Î»x. (âi<n. coef i * x ^ i) + coef n * x ^ n)"
   and "(Î»x. âi<Suc n. coef i *â©H x ^ i) = (Î»x. (âi<n. coef i *â©H x ^ i) + coef n *â©H x ^ n)"
    by (simp_all add: field_simps)

  then show ?case
  proof (simp)
    have "(Î»x. coef n * x ^ n) twice_field_differentiable_at Base x"
      using twice_field_differentiable_at_compose[of "Î»x. x ^ n" "Base x" "(*) (coef n)"]
      by simp
    then have "(*h* (Î»x. (âi<n. coef i * x ^ i) + coef n * x ^ n)) x =
          (*h* (Î»x. (âi<n. coef i * x ^ i))) x + (*h* (Î»x. coef n * x ^ n)) x"
      by (simp add: hypext_fun_add)
    moreover have "(*h* (Î»x. coef n * x ^ n)) x = coef n *â©H x ^ n"
      by (simp add: hypext_fun_scaleH hypext_power)
    ultimately have "(*h* (Î»x. (âi<n. coef i * x ^ i) + coef n * x ^ n)) x = (âi<n. coef i *â©H x ^ i) + coef n *â©H x ^ n"
      using hyp by simp
    then show "(*h* (Î»x. (âi<n. coef i * x ^ i) + coef n * x ^ n)) x = (âi<n. coef i *â©H x ^ i) + coef n *â©H x ^ n"
      by simp
  qed
qed

lemma hypext_fun_polyn:
    fixes coef :: "nat â 'a :: {real_normed_field}"
      and n :: nat
  assumes "f twice_field_differentiable_at (Base x)"
    shows "(*h* (Î»x. âi<n. coef i * (f x)^i)) x = (âi<n. (coef i) *â©H (((*h* f) x)^i))"
  using assms hypext_compose[of f x "Î»x. (âi<n. coef i * x^i)"] by (simp add: hypext_polyn)

end

Theory LogisticFunction

(*  Title:       LogisticFunction.thy
    Author:      Filip Smola, 2019-2021
*)

theory LogisticFunction
  imports HyperdualFunctionExtension
begin

subsectionâ¹Logistic Functionâº

textâ¹Define the standard logistic function and its hyperdual variant:âº
definition logistic :: "real â real"
  where "logistic x = inverse (1 + exp (-x))"
definition hyp_logistic :: "real hyperdual â real hyperdual"
  where "hyp_logistic x = inverse (1 + (*h* exp) (-x))"

textâ¹Hyperdual extension of the logistic function is its hyperdual variant:âº
lemma hypext_logistic:
  "(*h* logistic) x = hyp_logistic x"
proof -
  have "(*h* (Î»x. exp (- x) + 1)) x = (*h* exp) (- x) + of_comp 1"
    by (simp add: hypext_compose hypext_uminus hypext_fun_cadd twice_field_differentiable_at_compose)
  then have "(*h* (Î»x. 1 + exp (- x))) x = 1 + (*h* exp) (- x)"
    by (simp add: one_hyperdual_def add.commute)
  moreover have "1 + exp (- Base x) â  0"
    by (metis exp_ge_zero add_eq_0_iff neg_0_le_iff_le not_one_le_zero)
  moreover have "(Î»x. 1 + exp (- x)) twice_field_differentiable_at Base x"
  proof -
    have "(Î»x. exp (- x)) twice_field_differentiable_at Base x"
      by (simp add: twice_field_differentiable_at_compose)
    then have "(Î»x. exp (- x) + 1) twice_field_differentiable_at Base x"
      using twice_field_differentiable_at_compose[of "Î»x. exp (- x)" "Base x" "Î»x. x + 1"]
      by simp
    then show ?thesis
      by (simp add: add.commute)
  qed
  ultimately have "(*h* (Î»x. inverse (1 + exp (- x)))) x = inverse (1 + (*h* exp) (- x))"
    by (simp add: hypext_fun_inverse)
  then show ?thesis
    unfolding logistic_def hyp_logistic_def .
qed

textâ¹From properties of autodiff we know it gives us the derivative:âº
lemma "Eps1 (hyp_logistic (Î² x)) = deriv logistic x"
  by (metis Eps1_hypext hypext_logistic)
textâ¹which is equal to the known derivative of the standard logistic function:âº
lemma "First (autodiff logistic x) = exp (- x) / (1 + exp (- x)) ^ 2"
  (* Move to hyperdual variant: *)
  apply (simp only: autodiff.simps hyperdual_to_derivs.simps derivs.sel hypext_logistic)
  (* Unfold extensions of functions that have a hyperdual variant (all except exp): *)
  apply (simp only: hyp_logistic_def inverse_hyperdual.code hyperdual.sel)
  (* Finish by expanding the extension of exp and hyperdual computations: *)
  apply (simp add: hyperdualx_def hypext_exp_Hyperdual hyperdual_bases)
  done

textâ¹Similarly we can get the second derivative:âº
lemma "Second (autodiff logistic x) = deriv (deriv logistic) x"
  by (rule autodiff_extract_second)
textâ¹and derive its value:âº
lemma "Second (autodiff logistic x) = ((exp (- x) - 1) * exp (- x)) / ((1 + exp (- x)) ^ 3)"
  (* Move to hyperdual variant: *)
  apply (simp only: autodiff.simps hyperdual_to_derivs.simps derivs.sel hypext_logistic)
  (* Unfold extensions of functions that have a hyperdual variant (all except exp): *)
  apply (simp only: hyp_logistic_def inverse_hyperdual.code hyperdual.sel)
  (* Finish by expanding the extension of exp and hyperdual computations: *)
  apply (simp add: hyperdualx_def hypext_exp_Hyperdual hyperdual_bases)
  (* Simplify the resulting expression: *)
proof -
  have
    "2 * (exp (- x) * exp (- x)) / (1 + exp (- x)) ^ 3 - exp (- x) / (1 + exp (- x)) ^ 2 =
     (2 * exp (- x) / (1 + exp (- x)) ^ 3 - 1 / (1 + exp (- x)) ^ 2) * exp (- x)"
    by (simp add: field_simps)
  also have "... = (2 * exp (- x) / (1 + exp (- x)) ^ 3 - (1 + exp (- x)) / (1 + exp (- x)) ^ 3) * exp (- x)"
  proof -
    have "inverse ((1 + exp (- x)) ^ 2) = inverse (1 + exp (- x)) ^ 2"
      by (simp add: power_inverse)
    also have "... = (1 + exp (- x)) * inverse (1 + exp (- x)) * inverse (1 + exp (- x)) ^ 2"
      by (simp add: inverse_eq_divide)
    also have "... = (1 + exp (- x)) * inverse (1 + exp (- x)) ^ 3"
      by (simp add: power2_eq_square power3_eq_cube)
    finally have "inverse ((1 + exp (- x)) ^ 2) = (1 + exp (- x)) * inverse ((1 + exp (- x)) ^ 3)"
      by (simp add: power_inverse)
    then show ?thesis
      by (simp add: inverse_eq_divide)
  qed
  also have "... = (2 * exp (- x) - (1 + exp (- x))) / (1 + exp (- x)) ^ 3 * exp (- x)"
    by (metis diff_divide_distrib)
  finally show
    "2 * (exp (- x) * exp (- x)) / (1 + exp (- x)) ^ 3 - exp (- x) / (1 + exp (- x))â§2 =
     (exp (- x) - 1) * exp (- x) / (1 + exp (- x)) ^ 3"
    by (simp add: field_simps)
qed

end
d>

Theory AnalyticTestFunction

(*  Title:   AnalyticTestFunction.thy
    Authors: Filip Smola and Jacques D. Fleuriot, University of Edinburgh, 2019-2021

theory AnalyticTestFunction
  imports HyperdualFunctionExtension "HOL-Decision_Procs.Approximation"
begin

subsectionâ¹Analytic Test Functionâº
textâ¹
  We investigate the analytic test function used by Fike and Alonso in their
  2011 paper~@{cite "fike_alonso-2011"} as a relatively non-trivial example.
  The function is defined as: @{term "Î»x. exp x / (sqrt (sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3))"}.
âº
definition fa_test :: "real â real"
  where "fa_test x = exp x / (sqrt (sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3))"

textâ¹
  We define the same composition of functions but using the relevant hyperdual versions.
  Note that we implicitly use the facts that hyperdual extensions of plus, times and inverse are the
  same operations on hyperduals.
âº
definition hyp_fa_test :: "real hyperdual â real hyperdual"
  where "hyp_fa_test x = ((*h* exp) x) / ((*h* sqrt) (((*h* sin) x) ^ 3 + ((*h* cos) x) ^ 3))"

textâ¹We prove lemmas useful to show when this function is well defined.âº
lemma sin_cube_plus_cos_cube:
  "sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3 = 1/2 * (sin x + cos x) * (2 - sin (2 * x))"
  for x :: "'a::{real_normed_field,banach}"
proof -
  have "sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3 = (sin x + cos x) * (cos x ^ 2 - cos x * sin x + sin x ^ 2)"
    by (smt (z3) add.commute combine_common_factor diff_add_cancel distrib_left
          mult.commute mult.left_commute power2_eq_square power3_eq_cube)
  also have "â¦ = (sin x + cos x) * (1 - cos x * sin x)"
    by simp
  finally show ?thesis
    by (smt (z3) mult.commute mult.left_neutral mult_2 nonzero_mult_div_cancel_left
          right_diff_distrib' sin_add times_divide_eq_left zero_neq_numeral)
qed

lemma sin_cube_plus_cos_cube_gt_zero_iff:
  "(sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3 > 0) = (sin x + cos x > 0)"
  for x ::real
  by (smt (verit, best) cos_zero power3_eq_cube power_zero_numeral sin_cube_plus_cos_cube
       sin_le_one sin_zero zero_less_mult_iff)

lemma sin_plus_cos_eq_45:
  "sin x + cos x = sqrt 2 * sin (x + pi/4)"
  apply (simp add: sin_add sin_45 cos_45 )
  by (simp add: field_simps)

lemma sin_cube_plus_cos_cube_gt_zero_iff':
  "(sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3 > 0) = (sin (x + pi/4) > 0)"
  by (smt (verit, best) mult_pos_pos real_sqrt_gt_0_iff
      sin_cube_plus_cos_cube_gt_zero_iff sin_plus_cos_eq_45 zero_less_mult_pos)

lemma sin_less_zero_pi:
  "â¦- pi < x; x < 0â§ â¹ sin x < 0"
  by (metis add.inverse_inverse add.inverse_neutral neg_less_iff_less sin_gt_zero sin_minus)

lemma sin_45_positive_intervals:
  "(sin (x + pi/4) > 0) = (x â (ân::int. {-pi/4 + 2*pi*n <..< 3*pi/4 + 2*pi*n}))"
proof (standard ; (elim UnionE rangeE | -))
  obtain y :: real and n :: int
    where "x = y + 2*pi*n" and "- pi â¤ y" and "y â¤ pi"
    using sincos_principal_value sin_cos_eq_iff less_eq_real_def by metis
  note yn = this

  assume "0 < sin (x + pi / 4)"
  then have a: "0 < sin (y + pi / 4)"
    using yn by (metis sin_add sin_cos_eq_iff)
  then have "y â {- pi / 4<..<3 * pi / 4}"
  proof (unfold greaterThanLessThan_iff, safe)
    show "- pi / 4 < y"
    proof (rule ccontr)
      assume "Â¬ - pi / 4 < y"
      then have "y < - pi / 4 â¨ y = - pi / 4"
        by (simp add: not_less le_less)
      then show False
        using a sin_less_zero_pi[where x = "y + pi/4"] yn sin_zero
        by force
    qed
    show "y < 3 * pi / 4"
    proof (rule ccontr)
      assume "Â¬ y < 3 * pi / 4"
      then have "pi â¤ y + pi/4"
        by (simp add: not_less)
      then show False
        using a sin_le_zero yn pi_ge_two by fastforce
    qed
  qed
  then have "x â {- pi / 4 + 2*pi*n<..<3 * pi / 4 + 2*pi*n}"
    using yn greaterThanLessThan_iff by simp
  then show "x â (ân::int. {- pi / 4 + 2*pi*n<..<3 * pi / 4 + 2*pi*n})"
    by blast
next
  fix X and n :: int
  assume "x â X"
     and "X = {- pi / 4 + 2*pi*n<..<3 * pi / 4 + 2*pi*n}"
  then have "x â {- pi / 4 + 2*pi*n<..<3 * pi / 4 + 2*pi*n}"
    by simp
  then obtain y :: real and n :: int
    where "x = y + 2*pi*n" and "- pi / 4 < y" and "y < 3 * pi / 4"
    by (smt (z3) greaterThanLessThan_iff)
  note yn = this

  have "0 < sin (y + pi / 4)"
    using sin_gt_zero yn by force
  then show "0 < sin (x + pi / 4)"
    using yn sin_cos_eq_iff[of "x + pi / 4" "y + pi / 4"] by simp
qed

textâ¹When the function is well defined our hyperdual definition is equal to the hyperdual extension.âº
lemma hypext_fa_test:
  assumes "Base x â (ân::int. {-pi/4 + 2*pi*n <..< 3*pi/4 + 2*pi*n})"
  shows "(*h* fa_test) x = hyp_fa_test x"
proof -
  have inverse_sqrt_valid: "0 < sin (Base x) ^ 3 + cos (Base x) ^ 3"
    using assms sin_45_positive_intervals sin_cube_plus_cos_cube_gt_zero_iff' by force

  have "âf. (Î»x. (sin x) ^ 3) twice_field_differentiable_at Base x"
   and "âf. (Î»x. (cos x) ^ 3) twice_field_differentiable_at Base x"
    by (simp_all add: twice_field_differentiable_at_compose[OF _ twice_field_differentiable_at_power])
  then have "(*h* (Î»x. sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3)) x = (*h* sin) x ^ 3 + (*h* cos) x ^ 3"
        and d_sincos: "(Î»x. sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3) twice_field_differentiable_at Base x"
    using hypext_fun_add[of "Î»x. sin x ^ 3" x "Î»x. cos x ^ 3"]
    by (simp_all add: hypext_fun_power twice_field_differentiable_at_add)
  then have "(*h* (Î»x. sqrt (sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3))) x = (*h* sqrt) ((*h* sin) x ^ 3 + (*h* cos) x ^ 3)"
    using inverse_sqrt_valid hypext_compose[of "Î»x. sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3" x] by simp
  moreover have d_sqrt: "(Î»x. sqrt (sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3)) twice_field_differentiable_at Base x"
    using inverse_sqrt_valid d_sincos twice_field_differentiable_at_compose twice_field_differentiable_at_sqrt
    by blast
  ultimately have "(*h* (Î»x. inverse (sqrt (sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3)))) x = inverse ((*h* sqrt) ((*h* sin) x ^ 3 + (*h* cos) x ^ 3))"
    using inverse_sqrt_valid hypext_fun_inverse[of "Î»x. sqrt (sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3)" x]
    by simp
  moreover have "(Î»x. inverse (sqrt (sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3))) twice_field_differentiable_at Base x"
    using inverse_sqrt_valid d_sqrt real_sqrt_eq_zero_cancel_iff
          twice_field_differentiable_at_compose twice_field_differentiable_at_inverse
          less_numeral_extra(3)
    by force
  ultimately have
    "(*h* (Î»x. exp x * inverse (sqrt (sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3)))) x =
     (*h* exp) x * inverse ((*h* sqrt) ((*h* sin) x ^ 3 + (*h* cos) x ^ 3))"
    by (simp add: hypext_fun_mult)
  then have
    "(*h* (Î»x. exp x / sqrt (sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3))) x =
     (*h* exp) x / (*h* sqrt) ((*h* sin) x ^ 3 + (*h* cos) x ^ 3)"
    by (simp add: inverse_eq_divide hyp_divide_inverse)
  then show ?thesis
    unfolding fa_test_def hyp_fa_test_def .
qed

textâ¹
  We can show that our hyperdual extension gives (approximately) the same values as those found by
  Fike and Alonso when evaluated at @{term "1.5"}.
âº
lemma
  assumes "x = hyp_fa_test (Î² 1.5)"
  shows "Â¦Base x - 4.4978Â¦ â¤ 0.00005"
    and "Â¦Eps1 x - 4.0534Â¦ â¤ 0.00005"
    and "Â¦Eps12 x - 9.4631Â¦ â¤ 0.00005"
proof -
  show "Â¦Base x - 4.4978Â¦ â¤ 0.00005"
    by (simp add: assms hyp_fa_test_def, approximation 20)
  have d: "0 < sin (3/2 :: real) ^ 3 + cos (3/2 :: real) ^ 3"
    using sin_cube_plus_cos_cube_gt_zero_iff' sin_gt_zero pos_add_strict pi_gt3 by force
  show "Â¦Eps1 x - 4.0534Â¦ â¤ 0.00005"
    by (simp add: assms hyp_fa_test_def d, approximation 22)
  show "Â¦Eps12 x - 9.4631Â¦ â¤ 0.00005"
    by (simp add: assms hyp_fa_test_def d, approximation 24)
qed

textâ¹A number of additional lemmas that will be required to prove the derivatives:âº
lemma hypext_sqrt_hyperdual_parts:
      "a > 0 â¹  (*h* sqrt) (a *â©H ba + b *â©H e1 + c *â©H e2 + d *â©H e12) =
       sqrt a *â©H ba + (b * inverse (sqrt a) / 2) *â©H e1 + (c * inverse (sqrt a) / 2) *â©H e2 +
       (d * inverse (sqrt a) / 2 - b * c * inverse (sqrt a ^ 3) / 4) *â©H e12"
  by (metis Hyperdual_eq hypext_sqrt_Hyperdual)

lemma cos_multiple: "cos (n * x) = 2 * cos x * cos ((n - 1) * x) - cos ((n - 2) * x)"
  for x :: "'a :: {banach,real_normed_field}"
proof -
  have "cos ((n - 1) * x + x) + cos ((n - 1) * x - x) = 2 * cos ((n - 1) * x) * cos x"
    by (simp add: cos_add cos_diff)
  then show ?thesis
    by (simp add: left_diff_distrib' eq_diff_eq)
qed

lemma sin_multiple: "sin (n * x) = 2 * cos x * sin ((n - 1) * x) - sin ((n - 2) * x)"
  for x :: "'a :: {banach,real_normed_field}"
proof -
  have "sin ((n - 1) * x + x) + sin ((n - 1) * x - x) = 2 * cos x * sin ((n - 1) * x)"
    by (simp add: sin_add sin_diff)
  then show ?thesis
    by (simp add: left_diff_distrib' eq_diff_eq)
qed

lemma power5:
  fixes z :: "'a :: monoid_mult"
  shows "z ^ 5 = z * z * z * z * z"
  by (simp add: mult.assoc power2_eq_square power_numeral_odd)

lemma power6:
  fixes z :: "'a :: monoid_mult"
  shows "z ^ 6 = z * z * z * z * z * z"
  by (simp add: mult.assoc power3_eq_cube power_numeral_even)

textâ¹
  We find the derivatives of @{const fa_test} by applying a Wengert list approach, as done by Fike
  and Alonso, to make the same composition but in hyperduals.
  We know that this is equal to the hyperdual extension which in turn gives us the derivatives.
âº
lemma Wengert_autodiff_fa_test:
  assumes "x â (ân::int. {-pi/4 + 2*pi*n <..< 3*pi/4 + 2*pi*n})"
  shows "First (autodiff fa_test x) =
    (exp x * (3 * cos x + 5 * cos (3 * x) + 9 * sin x + sin (3 * x))) /
        (8 * (sqrt (sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3)) ^ 3)"
    and "Second (autodiff fa_test x) =
    (exp x * (130 - 12 * cos (2 * x) +
              30 * cos (4 * x) + 12 * cos (6 * x) -
              111 * sin (2 * x) +
              48 * sin (4 * x) + 5 * sin (6 * x))) /
                (64 * (sqrt (sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3)) ^ 5)"
proof -
  have s3_c3_gt_zero: "(sin x) ^ 3 + (cos x) ^ 3 > 0"
    using assms sin_45_positive_intervals sin_cube_plus_cos_cube_gt_zero_iff' sin_gt_zero
    by force
   â â¹Work out @{const hyp_fa_test} as Wengert list of basic operationsâº
  let ?w0 = "Î² x"
  have w0: "?w0 = x *â©H ba + 1 *â©H e1 + 1 *â©H e2 + 0 *â©H e12"
    by (simp add: Hyperdual_eq hyperdualx_def)

  let ?w1 = "(*h* exp) ?w0"
  have w1: "?w1 = exp x *â©H ba + exp x *â©H e1 + exp x *â©H e2 + exp x *â©H e12"
    using hypext_exp_extract by blast

  let ?w2 = "(*h* sin) ?w0"
  have w2: "?w2 = sin x *â©H ba + cos x *â©H e1 + cos x *â©H e2 + - sin x *â©H e12"
    by (simp add: hypext_sin_extract of_comp_minus scaleH_times)

  let ?w3 = "(*h* (Î»x. x ^ 3)) ?w2"
  have w3: "?w3 = (sin x) ^ 3 *â©H ba + (3 * cos x * (sin x)â§2) *â©H e1 + (3 * cos x * (sin x)â§2) *â©H e2 + - (3/4 * (sin x - 3 * sin (3 * x))) *â©H e12"
    by (simp add: w2 hypext_power_Hyperdual_parts power2_eq_square cos_times_cos sin_times_sin
          sin_times_cos distrib_left right_diff_distrib' divide_simps)

  let ?w4 = "(*h* cos) ?w0"
  have w4: "?w4 = cos x *â©H ba + - sin x *â©H e1 + - sin x *â©H e2 + - cos x *â©H e12"
    by (simp add: hypext_cos_extract of_comp_minus scaleH_times)

  let ?w5 = "(*h* (Î»x. x ^ 3)) ?w4"
  have w5: "?w5 = (cos x) ^ 3 *â©H ba + - (3 * sin x * (cos x)â§2) *â©H e1 + - (3 * sin x * (cos x)â§2) *â©H e2 + - (3/4 * (cos x + 3 * cos (3 * x))) *â©H e12"
    by (simp add: w4 hypext_power_Hyperdual_parts sin_times_sin right_diff_distrib' cos_times_cos
              power2_eq_square distrib_left sin_times_cos divide_simps)

  let ?w6 = "?w3 + ?w5"
  have sqrt_pos: "Base ?w6 > 0"
      using s3_c3_gt_zero by auto
  have w6: "?w6 = (sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3) *â©H ba +
                  (3 * cos x * sin x * (sin x - cos x)) *â©H e1 +
                  (3 * cos x * sin x * (sin x - cos x)) *â©H e2 +
                  - (3/4 * (sin x + cos x + 3 * cos (3 * x) - 3 * sin (3 * x))) *â©H e12"
    by (auto simp add: w3 w5 add_hyperdual_parts power2_eq_square right_diff_distrib' divide_simps)

  let ?w7 = "inverse ((*h* sqrt) ?w6)"
  have w7: "?w7 = inverse(sqrt(sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3)) *â©H ba +
                  - ((3 * cos x * sin x * (sin x - cos x))/(2 * (sqrt (sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3)) ^ 3)) *â©H e1 +
                  - ((3 * cos x * sin x * (sin x - cos x))/(2 * (sqrt (sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3)) ^ 3)) *â©H e2 +
                  ((3 * (30 + 2 * cos (4 * x) - 41 * sin (2 * x) + 3 * sin (6 * x)))/(64 * (sqrt (sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3)) ^ 5)) *â©H e12"
    â â¹Apply the functions in two steps, then simplify the result to matchâº
  proof -
    let ?w7a = "(*h* sqrt) ?w6"
    have w7a: "?w7a =
      sqrt (sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3) *â©H ba +
      ((3 * (cos x * (sin x * (sin x - cos x)))) * inverse (sqrt (sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3)) / 2) *â©H e1 +
      ((3 * (cos x * (sin x * (sin x - cos x)))) * inverse (sqrt (sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3)) / 2) *â©H e2 +
      (- ((3 * sin x + 3 * cos x + 9 * cos (3 * x) - 9 * sin (3 * x)) * inverse (sqrt (sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3)) / 8) +
       - 9 * (cos x * (sin x * ((sin x - cos x) * (cos x * (sin x * (sin x - cos x)))))) * inverse (sqrt (sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3) ^ 3) / 4) *â©H e12"
      unfolding w6
      using sqrt_pos by (simp add: hypext_sqrt_hyperdual_parts mult.assoc)

    let ?w7b = "inverse ?w7a"
    have "?w7b =
      (1 / sqrt (sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3)) *â©H ba +
      - (3 * (cos x * (sin x * (sin x - cos x))) * inverse (sqrt (sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3)) / (2 * (sqrt (sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3))â§2)) *â©H e1 +
      - (3 * (cos x * (sin x * (sin x - cos x))) * inverse (sqrt (sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3)) / (2 * (sqrt (sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3))â§2)) *â©H e2 +
      (9 * (cos x * (cos x * (sin x * (sin x * ((sin x - cos x) * ((sin x - cos x) * (inverse (sqrt (sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3)) * inverse (sqrt (sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3))))))))) / (2 * sqrt (sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3) ^ 3) -
        (- ((3 * sin x + 3 * cos x + 9 * cos (3 * x) - 9 * sin (3 * x)) * inverse (sqrt (sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3)) / 8) -
        9 * (cos x * (sin x * ((sin x - cos x) * (cos x * (sin x * (sin x - cos x)))))) * inverse (sqrt (sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3) ^ 3) / 4) /

      â â¹Push the inverse inâº
      by (simp add: w7a inverse_hyperdual_parts)

      (inverse (sqrt (sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3))) *â©H ba +
      - (3 * cos x * sin x * (sin x - cos x) / (2 * (sqrt (sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3)) ^ 3)) *â©H e1 +
      - (3 * cos x * sin x * (sin x - cos x) / (2 * (sqrt (sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3)) ^ 3)) *â©H e2 +

        (- ((3 * sin x + 3 * cos x + 9 * cos (3 * x) - 9 * sin (3 * x)) / (8 * sqrt (sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3))) -

      "9 * cos x * cos x * sin x * sin x * ((sin x - cos x) * (sin x - cos x)) / ((sqrt (sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3))â§2 * (2 * sqrt (sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3) ^ 3)) -

         ( (3 * sin x + 3 * cos x + 9 * cos (3 * x) - 9 * sin (3 * x)) / (8 * (sqrt (sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3)) ^ 3) +

        by (simp add: add_divide_distrib power2_eq_square power3_eq_cube mult.commute mult.left_commute)
      also have "... =
         9 * cos x * cos x * sin x * sin x * (sin x - cos x) * (sin x - cos x) / (2 * sqrt (sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3) ^ 5) +
         ( (3 * sin x + 3 * cos x + 9 * cos (3 * x) - 9 * sin (3 * x)) / (8 * (sqrt (sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3)) ^ 3) +
           9 * cos x * sin x * (sin x - cos x) * cos x * sin x * (sin x - cos x) / (4 * sqrt (sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3) ^ 5))"
        by (simp add: mult.commute mult.left_commute)
      also have "... =
         9 * cos x * cos x * sin x * sin x * (sin x - cos x) * (sin x - cos x) / (2 * sqrt (sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3) ^ 5) +
         ( (3 * sin x + 3 * cos x + 9 * cos (3 * x) - 9 * sin (3 * x)) * (sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3) / (8 * (sqrt (sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3)) ^ 5) +
           9 * cos x * sin x * (sin x - cos x) * cos x * sin x * (sin x - cos x) / (4 * sqrt (sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3) ^ 5))"
      proof -
        have "(sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3) * inverse ((sqrt (sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3)) ^ 2) = 1"
          using s3_c3_gt_zero by auto
        then have
          "1 / (8 * (sqrt (sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3)) ^ 3) =
           (sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3) / ((sqrt (sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3)) ^ 2) / (8 * (sqrt (sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3)) ^ 3)"
          by (simp add: field_simps)
        then have
          "1 / (8 * (sqrt (sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3)) ^ 3) =
           (sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3) / (8 * (sqrt (sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3)) ^ 5)"
          by auto
        then show ?thesis
          by (metis (mono_tags, lifting) divide_real_def inverse_eq_divide times_divide_eq_right)
      qed
      also have "... =
         ( 288 * cos x * cos x * sin x * sin x * (sin x - cos x) * (sin x - cos x) +
           (3 * sin x + 3 * cos x + 9 * cos (3 * x) - 9 * sin (3 * x)) * (sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3) * 8 +
           144 * cos x * sin x * (sin x - cos x) * cos x * sin x * (sin x - cos x))
         / (64 * (sqrt (sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3)) ^ 5)"
        by (simp add: divide_simps)
      also have "... =
         ( 432 * cos x * cos x * sin x * sin x * (sin x - cos x) * (sin x - cos x) +
           (24 * sin x + 24 * cos x + 72 * cos (3 * x) - 72 * sin (3 * x)) * (sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3))
         / (64 * (sqrt (sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3)) ^ 5)"
        by (simp add: divide_simps)
      finally show ?thesis
        â â¹Having matched the denominators, prove the numerators equalâº
        by (simp, force intro:  disjI2 simp add: power2_eq_square power4_eq_xxxx power3_eq_cube cos_times_sin
            sin_times_cos cos_times_cos sin_times_sin right_diff_distrib power6 power5
            distrib_left distrib_right left_diff_distrib divide_simps)
    qed
    then show ?thesis
      â â¹Put it all togetherâº
      by (simp add: w7b)
  qed

  let ?w8 = "?w1 * ?w7"
  have w8: "?w8 =
    ((exp x)/(sqrt(sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3))) *â©H ba +
    ((exp x * (3 * cos x + 5 * cos (3 * x) + 9 * sin x + sin (3 * x)))/(8 * (sqrt (sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3)) ^ 3)) *â©H e1 +
    ((exp x * (3 * cos x + 5 * cos (3 * x) + 9 * sin x + sin (3 * x)))/(8 * (sqrt (sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3)) ^ 3)) *â©H e2 +
    ((exp x * (130 - 12 * cos (2 * x) + 30 * cos (4 * x) + 12 * cos (6 * x) - 111 * sin (2 * x) + 48 * sin (4 * x) +
               5 * sin (6 * x)))/(64 * (sqrt (sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3)) ^ 5)) *â©H e12"
  proof (auto simp add: w7 w1 times_hyperdual_parts)
    show "exp x * inverse (sqrt (sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3)) = exp x / sqrt (sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3)"
      by (simp add: divide_inverse)

    have sqrt_sc3: "sqrt (sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3) ^ 3 = (sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3) * sqrt (sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3)"
      using s3_c3_gt_zero
      by (simp add: power3_eq_cube)
    then have "inverse (sqrt (sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3)) -
          (3 * cos x * sin x * (sin x - cos x)) / (2 * sqrt (sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3) ^ 3) =
          (3 * cos x + 5 * cos (3 * x) + 9 * sin x + sin (3 * x)) / (8 * sqrt (sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3) ^ 3)"
      using sqrt_pos
      apply (simp add: right_diff_distrib' sin_times_sin cos_times_cos sin_times_cos cos_times_sin power3_eq_cube left_diff_distrib' divide_simps)
      by (simp add: distrib_right cos_times_cos)
    then show " exp x * inverse (sqrt (sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3)) -
           exp x * (3 * cos x * sin x * (sin x - cos x)) / (2 * sqrt (sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3) ^ 3) =
          exp x * (3 * cos x + 5 * cos (3 * x) + 9 * sin x + sin (3 * x)) / (8 * sqrt (sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3) ^ 3)"
      by (simp add: algebra_simps)

    have "sqrt (sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3) ^ 8 =  (sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3) ^ 4"
      using s3_c3_gt_zero
      by (smt mult_2 numeral_Bit0 power2_eq_square power_even_eq real_sqrt_mult_self)
    moreover have "sqrt (sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3) ^ 5 =  (sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3) ^ 2 * sqrt (sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3)"
      by (simp add: mult.assoc power2_eq_square power5)
    ultimately
    have "(90 + 6 * cos (4 * x) - 123 * sin (2 * x) + 9 * sin (6 * x)) / (64 * sqrt (sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3) ^ 5) -
           3 * (cos x * ((sin x * (sin x - cos x)))) / sqrt (sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3) ^ 3 +
           inverse (sqrt (sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3)) =
           (130 - 12 * cos (2 * x) + 30 * cos (4 * x) + 12 * cos (6 * x) - 111 * sin (2 * x) + 48 * sin (4 * x) + 5 * sin (6 * x)) /
           (64 * sqrt (sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3) ^ 5)"
      using sqrt_pos
      apply (simp add: sqrt_sc3 power2_eq_square divide_simps)
      by (simp add: distrib_right distrib_left power3_eq_cube sin_times_sin sin_times_cos
              cos_times_cos cos_times_sin right_diff_distrib' left_diff_distrib' divide_simps)
    moreover have "âr a b c. (a::real) * b - c * (a * r) = a * (b - c * r)"
      by (simp add: right_diff_distrib)
    ultimately show "exp x * (90 + 6 * cos (4 * x) - 123 * sin (2 * x) + 9 * sin (6 * x)) / (64 * sqrt (sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3) ^ 5) -
               3 * (cos x * (exp x * (sin x * (sin x - cos x)))) / sqrt (sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3) ^ 3 +
              exp x * inverse (sqrt (sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3)) =
              exp x *
              (130 - 12 * cos (2 * x) + 30 * cos (4 * x) + 12 * cos (6 * x) - 111 * sin (2 * x) + 48 * sin (4 * x) + 5 * sin (6 * x)) /
              (64 * sqrt (sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3) ^ 5)"
      by (metis (mono_tags, opaque_lifting) distrib_left mult.left_commute times_divide_eq_right)
  qed

  â â¹Check that we have indeed computed the hyperdual extension of our analytic test function âº
  moreover have w8_eq_hyp_fa_test: "?w8 = (*h* fa_test) (Î² x)"
    using assms
    by (simp add: hyp_divide_inverse hyp_fa_test_def hypext_fa_test hypext_power)

  â â¹Now simply show that "extraction" of first and second derivatives are as expectedâº
  ultimately
  show "First (autodiff fa_test x) =
          (exp x * (3 * cos x + 5 * cos (3 * x) + 9 * sin x + sin (3 * x))) /
            (8 * (sqrt (sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3)) ^ 3)"
  and
    "Second (autodiff fa_test x) =
        exp x * (130 - 12 * cos (2 * x) +
                  30 * cos (4 * x) + 12 * cos (6 * x) -
                   111 * sin (2 * x) + 48 * sin (4 * x) + 5 * sin (6 * x)) /
       (64 * sqrt (sin x ^ 3 + cos x ^ 3) ^ 5)"
    by (metis autodiff_sel hyperdual_comb_sel)+
qed
